article.headline: Montana St. 61, Montana 52
article.story: BOZEMAN, Mont. -- Bobby Howard and Marquise Navarre had 12 points each, and Branden Johnson added 11 -- including five crucial points in the final two minutes -- as Montana State defeated Montana 61-52 on Saturday night. Johnson hit a 23-foot 3-point shot with 2:01 remaining to give the Bobcats (11-8, 6-2 Big Sky) a 54-50 lead after the Grizzlies had shaved a 10-point deficit down to one. After Montana moved to within 56-52, Johnson hit a driving layup with 29.5 seconds left. Montana State made three of four free throws in the final seconds. Brian Qvale led Montana (13-7, 4-4) with 18 points, and Jack McGillis added 12.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
